item.title: An Econometric Approach to Campaign Finance in the 21st Century
item.description: Motivation Over the past twenty years, political campaign expenditures in the United States have skyrocketed. In 1998, these expenditures amounted to $1.6 billion. In 2018, this number is projected to hit $5.2 billion (Center for Responsive Politics). This effect is often credited to the controversial 2010 Citizens United decision, which effectively prohibited the United States government from restricting independent expenditures for political communications.
